text: Bottle of the 2012 for our anniversary. Pours a clear tawny amber. Soft apple and caramel. Medium bodied, soft acidity, caramel, lovely apple. Long apple, bright acid. Incredibly complex, beautiful balance of acid and sweetness.
375ml bottle, wow lovely apple concentrated nose. Thick almost cloying yet acidic even. Sweet of course. Fuk Alex again keeping this short
Tasting at Matts, corked bottle, 9%, vintage 2013Bright amber color. Plenty of stewed apples, elegant spirits, luscious sweet gold, with a high degree of acidity.Rich and decadent,
Pours a gorgeous amber/red colour. Aroma of red apple skin and a hint of baking spice. Taste is very rich and viscous, with tartness to counter the intense sweetness. Just lovely.
Bottle - Vintage 2013 - Sweet cooked apple. Clear copper. Cooked Apple nice acidity a nice sweet crisp finish. Well done.

375mL bottle, pours clear caramel colour. Aroma is decadent, bringing out notes of baked caramel apples, toffee, and brown sugar. Flavour is decadent as hell, with a wonderful mix of baked caramel apples, brown sugar, toffee, and a lovely warming effect. Complex, wonderfully balanced and deep. One of the better Quebec ice ciders and thats saying something. Fantastic.

Has a golden-amber. No head, but it has Theres a big appley nose, lots of sugars, the nose hints at some beautiful acidity. This is sweet, has some caramelized apple notes, some apple skin, a very nice balancing acidity. Brown sugar, great balancing acidity, and the sweetness excellent as well.
Clear golden pour. Smells like sweet cider. Taste is nice but the sugar lasts a bit longer than the cider flavor. Very good - just a tad too sweet for me, even for ice cider.

2oz sample. Crystal clear deep gold pour. Aroma is nice, soft mellow slow-cooked apples, applesauce, cinnamon, very desserty, light caramel. Taste is sweet, rich, desserty and decadent, full chewy spicy apple flavor. Palate is rich, mouth coating. Very refined, well balanced ice cider.

1.5 ounce sample, an ice cider look but with these great alcohol legs on the edge of the glass. The aroma is out of this world. I love when ciders have baked apple aroma with light persimmon, ginger, honey. 

body is actually very thin. it has the tongue coating elements but doesnt last very long. the residual sugar intensity is at level 10 on this one wth apple, peach, pear, raisin.

Vintage 2012. Le nez est fruité comme pas un. Fraises, pommes, agrumes et autres fruits du verger se fondent dans une délicieuse sauce de sucre caramélisé. Le corps dense et riche transporte des saveurs fruitées assez plaisantes qui sortent un peu des sentiers battus. Enfin, pour moi, pour ma petite expérience personnelle dans le merveilleux monde des cidres de glace. Bel équilibre en finale. Un produit tout à fait délicieux.

2 oz sample from bottle (375 ml) at home. 2012 vintage. Clear bright golden with orangey tints leaving some nice legs on the glass. Aroma features some really nice berries along with red apples, musty notes, cinnamon, brown sugar, apple juice... quite complex! Taste is also red berries-forward with moderate sweetness, a bright but still not too intense acidity, apple pie, cinnamon, brown sugar and a bit of alcohol. Medium body. Oily mouthfeel and a bit tannic. Fruity/berries finish. Gentle and pleasant alcohol warmth. I wasnt expecting much from this ice cider after the weird old ladies vibe at the cidery but this is nothing short of stellar! The most red berries forward ice cider I have tried so far. Really tasty, quite complex and with a very well dosed alcohol presence. Awesome!

2012 vintage. pours unclear amber with some stunning legs - a pretty dark ice cider. woodsy and spicy apple caramel pie, lots of bright red apples with lots of red fruitiness - raspberries, strawberry jam; wood, spices. flat carbonation, medium-full body; balanced sweet and lightly tart woodsy-spicy finish. exceptional.

Bottle purchased at March de Sav in Montreal for approx. $18; shared at Ryans tasting with Paul, Vin, Al and Ryan. Pours a deep amber golden body. Mouthfeel is thick and rich with notes of apple pie, fruit skins, cinnamon sugar, melted caramel, lots of sugar and apple juice. Another stellar ice cider.

Bottle shared by Dad, good thing you brought that fresh apple dad juice tick dad. Notes of caramel sugar, Apple skin, Apple pie, and other fresh Berry as it warms up. Nice chewy mouthfeel with a layered finish. This got overshadowed by a Neige Recolte but was still very nice.
